title: Consolidate services into status command with robustness improvements

comment: CR-071 pre-review COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter title present: "Consolidate services into status command with robustness improvements". (2) Frontmatter revision_summary present: "Initial draft" -- acceptable for v0.1 executable document. (3) All 12 required CR sections per SOP-002 Section 6 are present and complete. (4) No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) in pre-approved sections 1-9; execution-phase template brackets in sections 10-11 are expected per SOP-002. (5) Traceability: references CR-069, CR-070, SOP-001, SOP-002 appropriately; no parent document (independent improvement). (6) No typos or errors found. (7) Formatting consistent throughout. (8) No RS/RTM required (agent-hub CLI, not SDLC-governed). Technical assessment: scope is well-defined across four files, current/proposed states correspond clearly, change description includes sufficient detail with code snippets, implementation plan logically phases the work, EI table maps to all planned changes plus UAT, and testing summary covers key scenarios.

CR-071 pre-review (second round, revised draft) COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter title present: "Consolidate services into status command with robustness improvements". (2) Frontmatter revision_summary present: "Revised: three sections always shown, expanded Agents table (uptime, start/stop policy), authoritative empty states, model/API expansion" -- appropriate for revised self-authorizing executable document. (3) All 12 required CR sections per SOP-002 Section 6 are present and complete. (4) No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) in pre-approved sections 1-9; execution-phase template brackets in sections 10-11 are expected per SOP-002. (5) Traceability: references CR-069, CR-070, SOP-001, SOP-002 appropriately; Parent Document correctly stated as None. (6) No typos or errors found. (7) Formatting consistent throughout. (8) No RS/RTM required (agent-hub CLI, not SDLC-governed). (9) Internal consistency verified: Files Affected in Section 2.3 matches Impact Assessment in Section 7.1 (6 files); EI table (8 items) maps to Implementation Plan phases; Testing Summary aligns with Proposed State. (10) Revisions from v0.1 are substantive and well-integrated: expanded scope to include models.py and routes.py, new Section 5.4 for model/API expansion, expanded Agents table with uptime/start/stop policy columns, new EI-3 for model/routes work, and authoritative empty-state messaging throughout.

CR-071 post-review COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter title present: "Consolidate services into status command with robustness improvements". (2) Frontmatter revision_summary present: "Revised: three sections always shown, expanded Agents table (uptime, start/stop policy), authoritative empty states, model/API expansion" -- acceptable for self-authorizing executable document. (3) All 12 required CR sections per SOP-002 Section 6 are present and complete. (4) No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) found. (5) All 8 EIs show Task Outcome: Pass with Performed By signatures populated (claude - 2026-02-09). Commits 6a33f1a (EI-1 through EI-7) and 1e05cb0 (timezone fix during EI-8 UAT) are documented. (6) No VARs required -- no failed EIs. (7) No controlled documents affected per Section 7.2; no documentation approval needed. (8) Evidence fully documented: Execution Summary (Section 11) provides narrative of all 8 EIs, the timezone deviation found during UAT, and its resolution. Execution Comments table has two entries documenting implementation and UAT completion. (9) SDLC prerequisites N/A -- agent-hub CLI is not SDLC-governed. (10) Pre-approved content (Sections 1-9) appears unchanged from v1.0 pre-approval; execution-phase edits confined to Sections 10-11. (11) Workflow compliance verified via audit trail: correct executable document sequence through two pre-review rounds (both RECOMMEND), pre-approval, release, execution, and post-review routing. (12) Formatting consistent throughout; no typos or errors found. (13) Traceability: references SOP-001, SOP-002, CR-069, CR-070 -- all valid controlled documents.

CR-071 post-review (second round) COMPLIANT. Verified: (1) Frontmatter title present: "Consolidate services into status command with robustness improvements". (2) Frontmatter revision_summary present: "Revised: three sections always shown, expanded Agents table (uptime, start/stop policy), authoritative empty states, model/API expansion". (3) All 12 required CR sections per SOP-002 Section 6 are present and complete. (4) No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) found. (5) All 8 EIs show Task Outcome: Pass with Performed By signatures populated (claude - 2026-02-09). Three commits documented: 6a33f1a (EI-1 through EI-7), 1e05cb0 (timezone fix during EI-8 UAT), and 3ea50db (cp1252 encoding fix). (6) No VARs required -- no failed EIs. (7) Execution Comments table now has 3 entries (up from 2 in first post-review): the new third entry documents the cp1252 encoding fix -- Unicode checkmark/cross/em-dash characters replaced with ASCII equivalents in services.py and cli.py to prevent UnicodeEncodeError on Windows cp1252 console, discovered during UAT when agent-hub launch failed before reaching the 409 test path. (8) Execution Summary (Section 11) updated to reference all three commits and both bugs found during UAT. (9) Pre-approved content (Sections 1-9) unchanged from v1.0 pre-approval; execution-phase edits confined to Sections 10-11. (10) Workflow compliance verified: correct withdrawal from post-approval back to execution for the cp1252 fix, checkout/checkin cycle, and re-routing for this second post-review. (11) Formatting consistent throughout; no typos or errors found. (12) Traceability: references SOP-001, SOP-002, CR-069, CR-070 -- all valid.
